messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Will you have time in the next 22 hours?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:36): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: And/or you?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:36): (to look at my personal statement)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:51): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I looked at it briefly, but unfortunately it looks much better than the older version so I can't think of anything non-trivial and constructive to suggest
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:51): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Maybe that isn't that unfortunate :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:51): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Depends on your perspective :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: My guidance teacher thinks it is ready :P
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:53): "The DOM API is the most verbose thing on earth" -- Andrew Dupont
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:53): (at panel in The Ajax Experience)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:54): document.getPropertyByPropertyNamePropertyValue()
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:55): Assuming he means the JS DOM API, that's not really true - it's beaten by the Java DOM API
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:55): (Lots of fun typing of type names and casts)

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:55): "I'd love to see a DOM binding for JavaScript that embraces the specifics of the language a bit more. More DOM Level 0 style, but still have that generic API for other languages." -- Andrew Dupont
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:55): If you do it right you shoudln't need to cast :)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:56): "The problem with the DOM API is arrogance." -- ... (dojo)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:57): "Please with querySelectorAll." -- John Resig
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:57): s/Please/Pleased/
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:58): "Using HTML chunks is easier with HTML5, which standardizes innerHTML. Hope compat improves" -- John Resig

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:58): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: Is there a right way to e.g. use getElementsByTagName (which returns a NodeList) and then call an Element (not Node) method on the result?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:59): "The verbosity is the biggest problem [of the DOM]" -- Chris Heilmann
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (23:59): "insertBefore order of arguments is confusing." -- Chris Heilmann
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:00): "Expect to see more JavaScript library methods in browsers." -- John Resig
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:00): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: how can you make a markup tree api in java that doesn't require casting and doesn't hoist every method to Node?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:00): "Amount of control libraries have is minimal unless they get involved." -- John Resig
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:00): I like the argument order - you always put the newly inserted argument first, regardless of whether you're doing appendChild or insertBefore or replaceChild
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:01): "Library vendors were not invited to take part in querySelectorAll until it was being implemented." -- John Resig
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:01): "Hope we get asked for feedback early." -- John Resig
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:01): sort of disagrees with those statements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:01): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: I'm assuming here that the hoist everythibg pattern isn't "right"
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: The right way was to not use java. I suppose my smiley wasn't non-serious enough
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:02): "We don't have much influence unless we participate in the standards process. Don't like doing that." ... (dojo)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:02): (panel is on JavaScript libraries, fwiw)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:02): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: Your smiley wasn't sufficiently informative for me to deduce it meant "don't use Java" :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:03): <abbr title="don't use java">:)</abbr>
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:04): "If you're in the position to decide what goes into the DOM spec and what not, you should say 'no' by default." -- Andrew Dupont
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:04): "CSS selectors obviously deserved a place in DOM Level 1." -- Andrew Dupont
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:05): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: would have deserved?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:11): wonders why JS library authors don't want us to add stuff to the DOM
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:12): Because stuff added to the DOM would be unbeatable competition for those libraries?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:12): The worse the DOM is, the more people will use those libraries, and the more their authors will become famous and rich
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:14): http://stackoverflow.com/questions/150577/which-browser-has-the-best-support-for-html-5-currently -- OpenID integration is quite nice
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:17): "We don't hate each other, we hate the browsers." -- Andrew Dupont
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:18): (from the rest of the chatting, I think by browser, they mean IE)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:22): Q: "If browsers all did the same thing and everything libraries did, would you guys go away?"
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:22): A: "In this scenario I have a unicorn and a bag full of money." (dojo guy)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:25): So a pony isn't good enough anymore?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (00:27): has to go, laptop battery fails
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (00:28): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: A unicorn is much more "web 2.0".
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (00:31): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: ponies are only for django users these days
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:32): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I can make a little time now. Although in a few minutes I will probably be told that I was supposed to be clearing my house
